title: How to Disable Autocorrect on an iPhone or iPod Touch

steps.title: Open your device's Settings.
steps.content: Open your device's Settings. It’s an app showing gray cogs that can be found on one of your home screens. The app might be nestled in a folder called Utilities or Extras if it’s not listed on the home screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap on General.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap on General . It’ll be the 8th option listed under the search bar.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap on Keyboard.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap on Keyboard . It’s the 11th option listed on the page.

steps.title: Slide the “Auto-Correction” button to the “Off” position.
steps.content: Slide the “Auto-Correction” button to the “Off” position. Doing so will prevent your iPhone from correcting your typing automatically when it believes you've made a typo, and will no longer provide suggestions.
